title: Geometry Wars
content: I've been out of the Keen scene for a while, but I have been representing Keen as BillyBlaze314 on xbox live.  Have any of you ever played Geometry Wars on the xbox 360?  I was up to 5th place (now 7th) on the leaderboard (out of about 100,000 people).  I made a video of the game I got the highscore, if anybody's interested.  [url=http://video.google.com/videoplay?docid=8882579799957136749&pl=true]video.google.com/videoplay?docid=8882579799957136749&pl=true[/url]  It's good to see that Keen is still alive!

title: Re: Geometry Wars
content:
Hi man, nice to see ya again. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] A lot has happened while you've been away, and Keen is still alive! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img]

For those newbies that haven't heard of this guy, he made the legendary first Keen 4 level by using a hex editor instead of some level editor!

Never heard of that game, but that's pretty nice accomplishment considering how many there are other players. Very neat.3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: Geometry Wars
content:
Another crusader returns.[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-british.gif[/img] -----------------
[img]http://www.geocities.com/anthalerero/pic/banner_eurovision.jpg[/img]

title: Re: Geometry Wars
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]he made the legendary first Keen 4 level by using a hex editor instead of some level editor![hr][/quote]

Well, that's not entirely true -- I used Ted5 (which I slightly modified with the source code), but I didn't have the graphics working properly, so it looked like a garbled mess in the editor, then I used a hex editor to append the level data to the end of the gamemaps file. I eventually wrote a little tool that would handle all the file modifying for me. That was before the ckxpatch utilities, which I think are really nice. But I did actually make a little level before that "first level" using only a hex editor, when I was figuring out how the level data was stored in the file. It was a silly small thing that only used the "block" tiles, but it worked!

title: ah, yes
content:
The mysterious ChargingMoose that I only know of from my days of looking around keen sites for mods and level packs (before i signed up here)

And we have the same little icon. Thats rare, TWO keen heads on a keen forum! Didn't expect that. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-cheeky.gif[/img] -Genius314
[url=http://planetck.spatang.com]PlanetCK[/url]

title: Re: Geometry Wars
content: I haven't played Geometry Wars in a while, but I quite enjoyed it after I got my 360. I didn't even by a full game until a week after I bought the thing.

title: Re: Geometry Wars
content:
Ah, nice interview.
Hmmm, this game seems to be more popular than I could've guessed from screens/videos -- perhaps there's some old school arcade feeling in it that people can't get enough. It's nice to see a modern game where the amount of polygons doesn't count but the actual gameplay does. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] 3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."
